input.command:
# Construct the string to hash
STRING_TO_HASH="barrancojared+llm@gmail.com:b6473f29-0c29-4078-aa0e-76dfcfdbe1e8"

# Compute the BLAKE2b512 hash
HASH=$(echo -n "$STRING_TO_HASH" | openssl dgst -blake2b512 | sed 's/^.* //')

# Make the next request with the hash in the X-Idempotency-Key header
curl -i -L -X POST \
-H "X-Application-Key: FDE-CHALLENGE-01" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-H "X-Idempotency-Key: $HASH" \
-d '{"name": "Jared Barranco", "email": "barrancojared+llm@gmail.com"}' \
challenge.rectanglehq.com
input.description: Compute hash and send next request with idempotency key

state.title:
# Construct the string to hash
STRING_TO_HASH="barrancojared+llm@gmail.com:b6473f29-0c29-4078-aa0e-76dfcfdbe1e8"

# Compute the BLAKE2b512 hash
HASH=$(echo -n "$STRING_TO_HASH" | openssl dgst -blake2b512 | sed 's/^.* //')

# Make the next request with the hash in the X-Idempotency-Key header
curl -i -L -X POST \
-H "X-Application-Key: FDE-CHALLENGE-01" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-H "X-Idempotency-Key: $HASH" \
-d '{"name": "Jared Barranco", "email": "barrancojared+llm@gmail.com"}' \
challenge.rectanglehq.com
